website_summaries.verdict: Multi-purpose weightlifting bench that can accommodate a lot of weight and different bar sizes.
pros: Weightlifting bench can go into an incline, decline, or flat position
Provides full-body workout with accessories like leg lift, lat tower, and preacher curl attachments
cons: Customers report that it is difficult and confusing to assemble

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Something that should be easy to assemble is made difficult by poorly written instruction booklet with terrible diagrams and a multi tool that was not designed for this assembly. Holes that don't align during installation That I had to forcefully make align. Do yourself a favor if you decide to buy this product. Purchase a Rachet set with an 11/16 socket and 3/4 socket...also have separate wrenches of those sizes .it will make your installation much easier and make you not want to jump off your roof
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good home bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good home bench for the price. Instructions are not difficult to follow and assembly is pretty quick if you are proficient with basic tools You can use it for squats as well if you're not too tall -- I'm 5'10" and am on the upper end of using it for squats. It's sturdy enough to handle a decent amount of weight. If you're maxing out this unit, you should probably be using a cage.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: NUMBER THE PIECES To prevent confusion during ASSEMBLY.
customer_reviews.text: The instruction for setup is not very clear. I set up 3rd of it and got confused as pieces started looking alike. Ended up ordering assembly technician through Amazon for $83. If you are in the military where you will have to move every couple years, this is not the best option for you since you might get frustrated like I did and have to pay someone to assemble it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-El

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for the price
customer_reviews.text: The coolest thing we have ordered! Amazing product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle n fierro

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece of equipment. Assembly requires patience...well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This bench is very awesome! Giving it a solid 5 stars, even though: a) the leg extension's plate holder is too close to the floor, for larger plates to be used (easy remedy = place a solid board underneath the unit's "Leg Lift Support Bar"), and b) the instruction manual is sub par. After having read other buyers' reviews, I knew to just take my time assembling the unit and think outside the box. My bench is extremely solid, and I am very happy that I chose this brand and version. ~ : )
customer_reviews.author: Creeped Out

customer_reviews.title: I am a fan!
customer_reviews.text: I agree that the instructions were not very clear, but if you apply a little logic it should not be all that difficult. The equipment is pretty sturdy. I like the build and stability.I replaced the standard size sleeve with an Olympic adapter:because all my weight plates are Olympic.It feels even better now.
customer_reviews.author: Smruthi

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, instructions not great.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions aren't great, as others have noted, but useable. The quality is very good for the price. The mid-width of the bench would really only be a problem for those using a very wide grip. I'm 5-11 and everything works fine for me. With some additional bracing, the lat pull down can be used in the rear stow location.
customer_reviews.author: Patton Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy assembly, taking one person about three hours, with only a couple of mis-labelled bolts that were easy to figure out. I can do pretty much everything I need to do, having found a couple of things that I'd not thought about. For anyone who simply wants to be able to do a well rounded weight routine on their own time, this is IT.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Walter Edgerton

customer_reviews.title: Casual User
customer_reviews.text: This weight bench is perfect for the casual weight lifter seeking to stay in shape. I'm 65 and am rehabbing from two total knees. Since getting my knees done, I've lost over 70 pounds by mildly watching what I eat, a recumbent bike and this weight bench and gained strength while doing it. It doesn't get any better than that.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This bench is more than I expected for the price. It is sturdy enough for the amount of weight I move and the attachments really work too. Love this bench, a welcome addition to my home gym!
customer_reviews.author: James Troche

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the end bench seat broke, but everything is still working well after 1 year of using this equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be pretty sturdy product but definitely not for the hardcore lifter
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled it last night. Seems to be pretty sturdy product but definitely not for the hardcore lifter. Instructions are a bit unclear but wasn't too bad if you think about what you are doing, it should make sense. Took about an hour for me to assemble. Overall,it's a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Long Le

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this weight bench and it arrived on time. While putting it together there were parts missing but amazon sent out replacement parts right away. Took about an hour to put together but was easy to do so. The price for this bench is well worth it. Just make sure you have a 6 foot ceiling for the lat pull down bar.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Just finished putting it together and it seems like a pretty solid product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just finished putting it together and it seems like a pretty solid product for the price. My only words of caution are that the directions for putting this product together are terrible. Thank god they included the explosion diagrams in the back. It is pretty hard to identify certain pieces and quite a few were mis-numbered/mislabeled. It could have been/should have been much easier. That said - for $200 or so - it was worth the struggle.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Need to understand instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were easy, it's a great machine, I have no complaints, great price,
customer_reviews.author: Lee r

customer_reviews.title: excellent bench
customer_reviews.text: we were looking for a bench with a preacher curl and when we saw this we were impressed with what you get for the money. it does take some time to put together (my husband did it in a couple of hours) but it is impressive. the lat bar, leg lifts, preacher bench - we are very pleased with this product and price. also, the shipping was timely and came a week earlier than expected. just make sure to measure your space as the bench is much wider and taller than it looks. i would highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sudha A. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves his!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband and he absolutely loves it. I don't know anything about stuff like this, so I am going purely off his reaction :)
customer_reviews.author: vanessa bell

customer_reviews.title: No regrets in buying it 👍
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Heavy duty and gets the job done 👍
customer_reviews.author: Potato

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were so frustrating to read, I was ready to send it back many times. Misprints, spelling errors, and wrong parts are all to blame. Also make sure you have an arsenal of tools available before you attempt to put this together. The two wrenches they send with it are horrible! I cut myself trying to use them!
customer_reviews.author: AMZ_2013

customer_reviews.title: The worst bench I've ever used!!
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it brief. If I could go back in time I would have spent triple the price for a quality bench. -The preachers bench vinyl was ripped when delivered. -The bench is VERY loose once assembled (correctly). -I HATE how the preachers bench is setup. Something I didn't notice when purchasing. All and all, I put it together and used it once or twice since. I use it more for a clothes rack than anything else. If I could I'd return it, but it's not worth the hassle due to the size of it, not to mention disassembly. Do yourself a favor and spend the money for a better bench.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench. Great for beginners to intermittent weight lifters.
customer_reviews.author: Unpronounceable

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bench
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment, just wish they would show some images of how to use the different functions. Setup starts out easy, but slowly gets harder.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Made for short people
customer_reviews.text: Leg extensions require a leg inseam of less than 32 inches or your feet will drag the ground. Lat pull-down and preacher curl bench would have been easier to use if they had quick release vs. screw-in pins. Instructions for assembly were good up to the point of assembling the Lat Pull-down and Back Bench. Back bench brace hole does not align with quick-release pin hole. Cushions on leg extension keep coming of while using but are easily placed back on. Overall I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The directions were horrible!! It took us about 8 hrs to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Pritt

customer_reviews.title: it's okay...
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay product. It's cheaply made and you have to be creative to make it work. - Forget about the leg extension attachment, it sits to low to the ground and you will not be able to add any weight to it. - The bench back does not sit flat completely, is permanently tilted down. - You may want to bolt it to the ground, is shaky and if you put too much weight on it it feels sometime the whole thing is going to tip over. Be creative when working out and don't expect the thing to be great.
customer_reviews.author: InPz

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Don't hesitate,buy this item tho a 7ft n above pulley may not meet your expectations bt it's a gd quality item,easy to assemble wen u follow instructions cz took me 2hrs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good olympic weight bench
customer_reviews.text: It is a good sturdy bench. The instructions to put it together were difficult to follow. Also, make sure that the ceiling clearance for the lat bar is enough. The coustmer service for this product was very good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mckee

customer_reviews.title: it comes together pretty quickly. They supply tools but you don't want ...
customer_reviews.text: first, it arrived on time. My son and I put it together and it wasn't very hard to do. If you can follow directions and have a little bit of know-how, it comes together pretty quickly. They supply tools but you don't want to use them. All you need is a socket and an adjustable wrench and you're good. The finished product is a solid bench with allot of options. Perfect for your basement or work-out area. I was able to use my old 5' bar but I had to move the inside collars out. I would recommend using at least a 6' bar.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sauer

customer_reviews.title: ... curl is a little cumbersome but all else is excellent
customer_reviews.text: The preacher curl is a little cumbersome but all else is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Damon M. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good powerbench
customer_reviews.text: Really nicely built powerbench for the price. The size is perfect for me. I would recommend it for anyone in the market to buy one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Dyslexicshark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value for the money! Assembly was straightforward, no missing pieces or poor fitment. The equipment looks really good! Way better than that golds gym junk at walmart, and as good as any of the stuff you'd find at bigger sporting goods stores that sell for twice the price. Im very, very happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: sung choe

customer_reviews.title: I spent about two hours from box to completion and the thing works great! really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this despite the reviews that it was cheap and hard to put together. I spent about two hours from box to completion and the thing works great! really sturdy. it has a lot of options for configuring for different workouts. its important to tighten all the connections down and make sure that you follow the directions, highly recommend this product for a first workout bench
customer_reviews.author: Chefmess

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this because the picture looked good and it was reasonably priced. When we were putting it together it became apparent it was cheaply made. The seat cushions don't fit tightly and slide 3 to 4 inches. I called their customer service and was told this was normal. The instructions were not clear and only offered brief explanations of each step. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of benches on-line and in stores before buying this one. Very happy, this one is worth the money. Sturdy, I recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A Good Set
customer_reviews.text: The whole family is really enjoying this set. We have had many other types of exercise equipment (Bow Flex, Weider, etc.). With the right weights, this one does most everything the more expensive sets do. This set is sturdy, but not overly bulky. Pieces can be interchanged easily for different type workouts. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a good workout, but doesn't want to "break the bank."
customer_reviews.author: skgeralds

customer_reviews.title: Awesome with one exception.
customer_reviews.text: Met my needs but had to drill holes in lat pull bar. Schematic didn't match with added crossbar that attached lat bar to frame.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy klotz

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Overall its a good product. Very disappointed in the lack of sturdiness in the lat pull down attachment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: PHOENIX 99225 Power Bench Mid Width
product_meta.description:
An outstanding value! A heavy-duty bench with sturdy 2.5 inch steel frame/uprights for durability and long life. Deluxe lat tower and preacher curl accessories included, with storage stands that attach to the rear of the bench. Warranty is 90 days parts, 1 year frame. Maximum user weight 275lbs., uprights 310lbs., leg lift 150lbs., lat tower 150lbs. Not recommended or guaranteed for user over this limit.

AMAZON.COM
Tired of heading to the gym for weight workouts? Turn to the mid-width Power Bench from Phoenix Health & Fitness, a multipurpose weight bench that offers incline, decline, and flat bench positions, along with leg lift, lat tower, and preacher curl attachments. As a result, you can work out virtually any muscle group in the comfort of your own home. The bench is ultra sturdy, with a heavy-duty 2.5-inch steel frame and uprights that are built for durability and long life. The deluxe boxed and stitched seat and leg cushions, meanwhile, are made of high-density foam for maximum comfort during strenuous lifts. Best of all, the bench accommodates both Olympic and standard weight bars, giving you plenty of options when building your home gym. Other details include an accessory storage stand that attaches to the rear of the bench, three Olympic weight adapters with spring clips, and adjustable uprights that conform to multiple uses. The Power Bench, which measures 74 by 84 by 50 inches (W x H x D), offers the following maximum tested weights: 275 pounds for the bench, 310 pounds for the uprights, and 150 pounds for the leg lift and lat tower. The bench isn't recommended or guaranteed for use over these limits. The Power Bench also carries a 90-day warranty on labor and a one-year warranty on the frame. 

 Specifications:

 * Heavy-duty, 2.5 inch steel frame/uprights for durability 
 * Features incline, decline, and flat bench seat positions 
 * Deluxe boxed, stitched cushions for comfort 
 * Deluxe Lat Tower and Preacher Curl accessories included; storage stands attach to the rear of the bench 
 * Adjustable uprights for multiple uses 
 * Will accept standard or Olympic weight bars 
 * Three Olympic weight adapters and spring clips included 
 * Dimensions: 74" x 50" x 84" 

 About Phoenix Health & Fitness
Established in 1998 as a wholesale distributor of fitness equipment, Phoenix Health & Fitness offers a complete line of high-quality exercise equipment to the in-home and light commercial markets. Working with a state-of-the-art computer system, the company can offer "just in time" delivery and other critical services while living up to its standards of reliability, consistency, honesty, and urgency. Phoenix Health & Fitness develops many of its new concepts and products in conjunction with its sister company, Reflex Design, and enjoys a reputation for delivering quality products in a timely manner.
feature_bullets: Multipurpose weight bench with incline, decline, and flat bench positions
Comes with leg lift, lat tower, and preacher curl attachments
Heavy-duty 2.5-inch steel frame built for stability and long life
Accommodates Olympic and standard weight bars; accessory storage stand
Measures 74 x 84 x 50 inches (W x H x D); 1-year frame warranty
